intro: Hieracium gymnerosulum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. It has basal leaves that are narrow and linear, and its yellow flowers are surrounded by pale green ray florets. Hieracium gymnerosulum is often found in temperate regions and is known for its ability to colonize open habitats.
